cellKey 0.15.1
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Introduction to the cellKey-Package
  • Changelog

ck_create_pTable

ck_create_pTable.Rd

generates perturbation tables using functionality from package ptable

ck_create_pTable(D, V, type, js = 0, pstay = NULL, optim = 1,
  mono = TRUE, epsilon = 0.0000001, pTableSize = 70)

Arguments

D

perturbation parameter for maximum perturbation (scalar or vector)
V

perturbation parameter for variance (scalar)
type

character specifying the format of the input table. Valid choices are "abs" and "destatis".
js

treshold value for blocking of small frequencies (i.e. there won't occur positive target frequencies below the treshold value)
pstay

optional parameter to set
optim

optimization parameter: 1 standard approach (default)
mono

(logical) vector specifying optimization parameter for monotony condition
epsilon

(double)
pTableSize

(number) defining the number of required columns in the "abs"-approach

Value

an object of class ptable defined in the ptable-package.

See also

This function uses functionality from package ptable (https://github.com/sdcTools/ptable), expecially pt_create_pParams and pt_create_pTable. More detailed information on the parameters is available from the respective help-pages of these functions.

Examples

# abs-format of perturbation table
ck_create_pTable(
  D = 5,
  V = 3,
  js = 2,
  pTableSize = 70,
  type = "abs"
)
#> An object of class "ptable"

# destatis-format of perturbation table
ck_create_pTable(
  D=5,
  V=3,
  js=2,
  pstay=0.5,
  optim=1,
  mono=TRUE,
  typ="destatis"
)
